name: gyrate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to turn around and around on a fixed point, usually quickly
to dance, especially in a sexual way: A line of male dancers gyrated to the music while the audience screamed their appreciation.
(of prices, markets, etc.) to change quickly and often: As the markets gyrated, they rushed to hedge themselves against further currency swings. The world's currencies are gyrating wildly as fears grow about economic imbalances.
